required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Investigate Genetic Causes of Severe Early Childhood Onset Obesity.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to investigate genetic causes of early childhood obesity.
We will enroll children with severe early onset obesity (BMI > 99th percentile) diagnosed prior to 6 years of age. We will ask questions about their health, eating behavior and perform a brief physical examination. We will collect saliva or blood to perform genetic testing. We will also invite family members to participate in the genetic study.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a clinical and genomic study designed to investigate monogenic causes of severe early childhood obesity.
Subjects with severe early onset obesity attending clinics at Boston Children's Hospital will be identified by screening of the clinical database. These subjects will be invited to participate in the study. After obtaining informed consent, we will obtain history on the proband and the family. We will perform a brief examination and collect genetic material.
Targeted sequencing of genes associated with monogenic and syndromic forms of obesity will be performed using next-generation sequencing at Broad Institute, Cambridge, MA. In selected individuals with favorable family history, full exome sequencing will be performed. Functional analysis of newly identified variants will be performed where possible.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of known or novel genetic variants in genes that underlie obesity.
primary_outcome.description: Identification of known or novel genetic variants in genes that underlie obesity.

secondary_outcome.description: We will test the hypothesis that 1-3% of early onset obesity could be explained by carriage of mutation of monogenic obesity such as melanocortin receptor 4 in a mixed pediatric population.

arm_group.description: The study will enroll children older than 3 years of age with BMI > 99th percentile noted at an age < 6 years of age.

study_pop.textblock: This study will enroll children > 3 years of age with BMI > 99th percentile for age noted at an age < 6 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 3 years of age
- BMI > 99th percentile at age < 6 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known genetic causes of obesity
- Known Endocrine causes of obesity.
- Neurologic tumor, trauma or surgery
- Prior malignancy or transplant
- Known autoimmune diseases
- Edema of a known or unknown cause
- Prolonged steroid use.
